title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Thursday 8 December 2016 - BBC News
summary: van driver caught speeding at 105mph in 60mph zone , in police crackdown .
mum 'so proud ' of daughter who 'saved life ' using facetime .
devon and cornwall police criticised for not vetting more than 300 staff in line with national standards .
new royal navy vessel to be called hms tamar .
a new international mining business has been formed to try to reopen a mine on the flanks of kit hill in cornwall .
red arrows could return to fowey .
newquay surfer ben skinner in round four of longboard champs .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: thanks for joining us at bbc local live for devon and cornwall
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon & cornwall for today , we 'll be back at 08:00 to bring you all the day 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
do n't miss bbc spotlight at 18:30 and the late bulletin at 22:30 tonight .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: patrol ship is named after river tamar
text: work has started on a royal navy ship named after the river tamar which flows between devon and cornwall .
it is one of two offshore patrol ships in a £ 278m ontract to build two more offshore patrol vehicles in the uk .
minister harriett baldwin pressed the button at the govan shipyard to cut the first steel on hms tamar .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: newport 's healey approached by plymouth
text: newport county striker rhys healey has confirmed fa cup rivals plymouth argyle have made an approach for him .
the 22-year-old , on loan from cardiff city , has scored six goals in 18 appearances for county this season and says he was aware of the approach before the 0-0 fa cup second round draw with argyle .
`` i 've heard there 's been interest as well but it 's not for me to be dealing with that so i 've left it for someone else to deal with , '' he told bbc radio wales .
`` i 'm not surprised because if any striker 's scoring goals they 're going to get interest . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: council backs pause in health reforms
text: council backs pause in health reforms

documents.title: weather outlook for devon and cornwall : mild tonight and tomorrow
text: a breezy , mild and cloudy night will follow for all parts with low cloud , hill fog and further outbreaks of patchy rain and drizzle , especially over the moors .
minimum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
friday will be rather cloudy and very mild , with patchy light drizzle , but also some brighter spells to the east of higher ground .
the winds will then increase later as a band of locally heavy rain arrives overnight .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
author: David Braine
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: students implement hilarious orange juice 'ban ' on campus to make a point about university censorship
text: a student union has banned '' orange juice with bits in a farcical critique of universities who have blocked the sale of tabloid newspapers on campus .
author: The Huffington Post

documents.title: staff 'were vetted ' police insist in row over inspection report
text: devon and cornwall police insist none of their staff failed to be vetted - but that the goalposts for such checks have been changed - amid criticism from inspectors .
the latest report by her majesty 's inspector of constabulary has rated the force as good but said improvements have to be made to ensure some 300 staff members pass the national vetting procedures .
assistant chief constable russ middleton said : `` we do vet every single person , these people were vetted and will be reviewed and will be updated to the new vetting .

`` so we 've taken it on board as an area of improvement to move to the new national standard of vetting but they were and are up to the local standard which we used to have before we moved to the national standard . ''

documents.title: a lot of my friends are on zero hours contracts ' - mine worker hayley thankful for job
text: hayley clark from launceston , a fitter at the new hemerdon tungsten mine , compares her lot in life with the position some of her old school friends are in .
it comes as metal prices rise and more interest is shown in old mines reopening including a former tin mine at kit hill in cornwall .
so far , none of these schemes in the south west have seen protesters trying to lie down in front of bulldozers .
that may be because of the quality of jobs known to be associated with modern mining .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: ikea says you should n't have to travel more than 2.5 hours to reach a store - then shuns cornwall
text: swedish flat-pack furniture giant ikea has shunned cornwall after confirming it has no plans whatsoever for a store south of the tamar .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: the moment 2,000 students go silent in campaign to curb young deaths on the roads
text: `` the theatre is dark , the lights go down and they have little idea what they are in store for .
`` two thousand students , of the age to start driving or just started driving .
a few mobile phones are flickering whilst snapchats are read , and whatsapps are contributed to and then silence . ''
that 's sgt harry tangye from devon and cornwall police writing about the learn2live campaign to try and curb the number of young drivers dying on the road .

`` there is clear guidance on how to avoid getting into dangerous positions , and it is very much directed to not lecture students , as we know that does n't work , but to make them aware of the choices they have , '' he says .
`` if they feel they are in danger in a car , it 's because they actually are in danger . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: mp bradshaw pours cold water on brexit plan
text: labour mp for exeter , ben bradshaw , says he `` does n't have confidence '' the brexit plan `` will amount to very much '' as major issues like the single market are still `` undecided '' .
he thinks key european elections , such as in germany and france , will change the dynamic of negotiations .

documents.title: exeter city councillors approve increase in allowances
text: exeter 's city councillors will see their allowances increase by one per cent next year .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: why mining firm is interested in restarting operations near kit hill
text: plans to reintroduce tin mining to east cornwall have been welcomed .
check the tin price - higher now than most of the 20th century .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: motorcyclist caught speeding at 145mph on a38
text: these are just some of the offences by drivers seen in a clampdown by devon , cornwall and dorset police .
operation vortex ran from 14 to 29 november .
six unmarked traffic cars were deployed along with automatic number plate recognition ( anpr ) analysts .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'i will be more aggressive ' - songo'o
text: plymouth argyle defensive midfielder yann songo'o says he will be `` a little bit more aggressive '' after avoiding a fifth yellow card and a suspension .
the 25-year-old had to last seven games before the 30 november cut-off date to avoid a one-match ban .
`` it was a difficult period because i 'm an aggressive player , so it was quite difficult for me to hold myself in certain situations , '' the cameroonian told bbc sport .
`` i 'm not looking to get yellow cards but i will definitely be a little bit more aggressive now . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: drug driver caught forty times over the limit
text: hundreds of drivers putting themselves and others at risk on the region 's roads have been stopped in their tracks during a major police clampdown .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: crime victims given special advice by police
text: elderly and vulnerable people in devonport , in plymouth , who 've been the target of crime , are due to be given special advice by the police .
pcsos and neighbourhood beat managers will be spending the coming fortnight hosting scam awareness sessions and putting on property marking events in an effort to cut crime .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: 'great day ' says first sea lord on hms tamar start
text: one of the royal navy 's two new offshore patrol vessels is to be named hms tamar .
the defence minister , harriet baldwin , says it continues the tradition of recognising the service , history and battle honours of earlier ships of the same name .

documents.title: powercut in st austell
text: powercut in st austell

documents.title: mp eustice 'excited ' about tin mining prospect at kit hill
text: environment minister and cornish mp george eustice says he 's excited that tin mining could return to east cornwall .
test drilling will begin again soon at redmoor mine at kit hill near callington 80 years after it last operated .
mr eustice said : `` tin is really in demand .
it 's in solder for iphones and mining only stopped because the price went down and not because of the lack of resources . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: shingle for storm-hit beach
text: shingle for storm-hit beach

documents.title: 'i nearly died in surf accident ' says inspirational disabled soldier now bidding for world title
text: a disabled former serviceman who nearly died after passing out while surf kayaking has defied advice - and the fears of his wife - to compete for team gb in the world championships this weekend .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: new royal navy vessel to be called hms tamar
text: one of the royal navy 's two new offshore patrol vessels is to be named hms tamar with construction formally starting today .
the defence minister , harriet baldwin , says it continues the tradition of recognising the service , history and battle honours of earlier ships of the same name .
since 1758 , six ships have been named after the river tamar .
most recently , hms tamar was the name of the royal navy 's shore base in hong kong until 1997 .

the ministry of defence says these new 2,000 tonne ships , together with the three already in build , will deliver a more modern and capable fleet , supporting destroyers and frigates as well as enhancing the contribution to maritime security and fisheries protection .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: mums-to-be travel more than 20 miles to see consultants
text: mothers-to-be in okehampton and honiton had to travel more than 20 miles to see consultants after being admitted to give birth in midwife-led units , it has emerged .
researchers at the bbc examined hospital trusts across the country and found a quarter of women were being transferred because of complications when giving birth .
nhs bosses in england say stand-alone midwife units are as safe as doctor-led care for low-risk deliveries .
author: Daniel Wainwright
Data unit - English regions

documents.title: sexual assault on train between plymouth and london
text: british transport police are appealing for information after a woman was sexually assaulted on a train between plymouth and london paddington last month .
the force told the bbc a 21-year-old woman was `` inappropriately touched '' by a man who sat next to her .
she boarded the train at plymouth at about 09:00 on 11 november .
the woman challenged the man who then moved to a different seat .
he left the train at paddington .
officers said they would like to talk to the man in this photo in connection with the incident .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: grandmother praises facetime after mum 's life saved by daughter
text: the grandmother of a woman whose life was saved by her daughter on facetime says despite not being a fan of video calling - she 's changed her mind .
nanny collette said : `` i hate facetime and i was n't very pleased that my grandchildren knew how to use facetime .
i take it all back .
every child should be told how to use facetime . ''
pregnant tracey riches from paignton suffers from severe morning sickness .
when she passed out on monday morning mikayla facetimed her nanny saying she could n't wake mummy up .
she stayed connected until help arrived .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: test drilling for tin to start next year at kit hill
text: test drilling for tin at kit hill in east cornwall will start in the first half of next year , with about 20 test holes in all being sunk .

cornwall resources , a partnership between an australian and a british mining company that holds the exploration rights , said there 's a good three years of study before there any decision to go into actual mining .
and experience elsewhere suggests it could well require far longer .
but the price of tin has seen a huge rise through 2016 .
this is why at south crofty , the last tin mine to close , the canadian firm strongbow exploration have invested in a brand new trial water treatment plant .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: torquay boss nicholson 'grateful ' for moore loan
text: torquay united manager kevin nicholson says he is `` grateful '' to kieffer moore and forest green for the striker 's month-long loan spell at plainmoor .
moore , 24 , scored five goals in four national league games for the gulls but has now returned to his parent club .
`` it was one of those loans which worked for everybody , '' nicholson told bbc radio devon .
`` come january , when mark cooper sits down and sees what he needs and what he thinks he can tinker with , i 'll go and ask that [ moore loan ] question again . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: minister visits exeter £ 32m flood defences
text: floods minister therèse coffey is visiting the site where work to strengthen exeter 's £ 32m flood defences continues .
the exeter flood defence scheme is designed to better protect 3,200 homes and businesses in the city .
the first phase of the £ 32m scheme was put to the test for the first time by storm angus last month , with phase two now under construction and due for completion in 2018 .
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: video : new lidl store opens in bideford despite ribbon cutting problems
text: people were queuing in the dark to be the first to shop in bideford 's newest supermarket this morning .
author: North Devon Journal

documents.title: sixth former transport cuts planned
text: cornwall council 's planning to cut transport support for sixth formers to save £ 1.5m .
the council says this is down to a shortage of funding from the government and that it 's not legally required too offer assistance to over 16s .
a consultation 's on its way , amid fears changes will particularly impact those in rural areas with fewer transport links , and lower income families .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: bentley driver nabbed for no insurance
text: the driver of a £ 140,000 bentley arrested for no insurance was among more than 400 drivers caught committing offences in a clampdown by police in devon , cornwall and dorset .
operation vortex last month saw :

insp pete thomas from operation vortex said : there are still far too many motorists prepared to break the law and the consequences are quite likely to be tragically more people killed or seriously injured on our roads . ''
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: mine nearly opened at kit hill in 1980s
text: the company behind trying to reopen a mine on the flanks of kit hill in east cornwall says a mine nearly opened there in the 1980s .
the redmoor mine at kelly bray was last worked in the 1930s and is known to contain lots of high-grade tin .
`` redmoor came very close to being opened as a mine in the 1980s , '' said gary fietz , one of the directors of cornwall resources ltd .

`` so i think we 're in an environment where we 've got supportive commodity prices and if we 're successful in our mining next year then i think it 's a realistic proposition to have an underground mine here , '' he added .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: mp bradshaw wants talks on allowing eu citizens to work in britain
text: exeter 's labour mp ben bradshaw wants parliament to have more say over the details of negotiations with the eu including rights of eu citizens to work here .
it came after mps last night approved the government 's timetable for leaving the european union , which would begin negotiations next spring .

`` that could involve voting for amendments on the single market , on the customs union , on giving the rights for british citizens to stay in the uk and eu citizens to stay here , '' said mr bradshaw .
`` those are the sorts of things where there is a clear parliamentary majority in favour . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: van driver caught speeding at 105mph in 60mph zone
text: these are just some of the offences by drivers seen in a clampdown by devon , cornwall and dorset police .
operation vortex ran from 14 to 29 november .
six unmarked traffic cars were deployed along with automatic number plate recognition ( anpr ) analysts .
almost 90 drivers were caught using mobile phones , including one foreign lorry driver who was issued with an on the spot £ 100 fine , which had to be paid immediately .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: warnings over cutbacks to school transport for sixth formers
text: there are warnings about plans to cut back on school transport support for cornwall 's sixth formers .
cornwall council 's suggestions include slashing the current subsidy for post-16s .
the authority says it wants to continue to offer assistance - but it 's not legally required to help and it ca n't afford the whole £ 1.5m bill .
a consultation 's on its way , amid fears changes will particularly impact those in rural areas with fewer transport links , and lower income families .
the department for education told us the responsibility for transport for 16 to 19 year olds rests with councils .
colleges and schools also receive the 16 to 19 bursary fund to meet the needs of disadvantaged young people .
this can be used to help with travel costs .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: zoos 'monitoring bird flu situation '
text: bird experts at paignton zoo , living coasts and newquay zoo are `` monitoring the bird flu situation closely '' .
the h5n8 strain of avian influenza has been found elsewhere in europe , but has not yet been found in the uk .
the whitley wildlife conservation trust , which runs the zoos , said : `` at this stage defra is offering advice to be implemented where practical .
this includes feeding birds indoors or restricting wild birds ' access to the food and water for birds in the zoo collection .
`` poultry at paignton zoo and newquay zoo are being rounded up and kept indoors .
waterfowl are already fed in ways that restrict the access of wild birds .
staff are being prudent and aware and will follow defra guidelines . ''
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: kit hill mine could 'benefit area ' says councillor
text: a local cornwall councillor believes plans for a new mine at kit hill have the potential to benefit the area .
a new international mining business has been formed to try to reopen a mine on the east cornwall site .
andrew long said : `` the potential of any new jobs is good but we have to make sure that any impact will be mitigated if they do decide [ to go ahead ] .
`` there is no guarantee that this is going to happen . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: morpurgo reads fairytale about leicester 's premiership victory
text: it 's a football fairytale in this morning 's today programme advent calendar .

to celebrate leicester 's unlikely premiership victory back in may , we asked the acclaimed children 's author michael morpurgo from devon to write us a fairytale based on the club 's magical season .
watch here .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: missing woman , 54 , found 'safe and well '
text: devon and cornwall police say they 've found a missing woman from cornwall safe and well .
anne-marie zaazaa , 54 , went missing yesterday - officers have thanked the public for their help .

documents.title: iconic torbay seafront sites up for grabs as council 'maximises opportunities '
text: brixham 's iconic breakwater lighthouse and the unique stone gatehouses at torquay recreation ground are just two of the unusual sites up for grabs in a new portfolio of concessions being offered by torbay council .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: red arrows could return to fowey
text: plans are in place to bring the red arrows back to fowey next year .

there was widespread dismay when they could n't fly this year due to changes in safety regulations for routines above populated areas - and the fowey regatta committee made the decision not to book a display that was forced to fly out to sea .
but the fowey harbour master paul thomas says his department will take the lead to bring them back and is already in talks with the royal air force .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: crossbow attacker sent to mental health unit
text: a crossbow attacker has been sent to a mental hospital for an assessment of whether he should receive psychiatric treatment rather than a jail sentence .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: enjoy the mild temperatures , cooler conditions to come
text: enjoy the mild temperatures , cooler conditions to come

documents.title: skinner in round four of longboard champs
text: newquay surfer ben skinner is through to round four of the jeep world longboard championships in china .
he beat the american kevin skvarna in his heat this morning .

documents.title: mine could reopen on kit hill
text: a new international mining business has been formed to try to reopen a mine on the flanks of kit hill in east cornwall .
the redmoor mine at kelly bray was last worked in the 1930s and is known to contain lots of high-grade tin .
the tin price is now higher than it was throughout most of the 20th century .
test drilling will start within months but a full mine would need planning consent and many tens of millions of pounds .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: force under fire on staff vetting
text: a new report has criticised devon and cornwall police for not vetting more than 300 staff in line with national standards .
the force said the staff were vetted to local requirements , but national standards would now be introduced .
overall , her majesty 's inspectorate of constabulary rated devon and cornwall police as `` good '' at maintaining public trust and treating communities fairly .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: major plans to expand newquay and change the face of the town forever set to be approved
text: major plans to expand newquay and bring thousands more people to the town are set to be approved today .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: mum 'so proud ' of daughter who 'saved life ' using facetime
text: a pregnant woman from paignton says she is very proud of her three-year-old daughter who used a video calling programme to raise the alarm after she fell unconscious .
tracey riches suffers from severe morning sickness .
when she passed out on monday morning mikayla used facetime to contact her grandmother saying she could n't wake mummy up .
she stayed connected until help arrived .
tracey is now recovering well and said : `` it 's all a bit of a blur .
all i could think of was how different things could have been had mikayla not known how to use my phone .
`` i 'm so proud , prouder than i ever thought i could be . ''
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: police 'increasingly concerned ' for missing man
text: police say they are `` increasingly concerned '' for missing man , jason westbourne , who disappeared more than a week ago from torpoint , in cornwall .
he was last seen on monday 28 november , and is thought to be in the dorset area or possibly london .
mr westbourne is also known as christopher mckenzie .
the 50-year-old is described as 5ft 10ins with long , dark receding hair which is usually tied back in a ponytail .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: first world war soldier commemorated 96 years after he died
text: a soldier fatally injured in the first world war has been commemorated with a new headstone , almost a century after he died .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall : generally cloudy with outbreaks of rain and drizzle
text: it 'll be a generally cloudy day with outbreaks of rain and drizzle becoming confined to high ground during the afternoon .
low cloud will cover high ground and parts of the coast , but may lift for a time to give some brighter periods east of the moors .
moderate or fresh southwesterly winds will be strong at times before easing later .
maximum temperature : 14c .
author: Emily Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines for devon and cornwall
text: headlines for devon and cornwall
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: getting in the christmas spirit
text: getting in the christmas spirit

documents.title: daughter , 3 , 'saves life ' of pregnant mum
text: a pregnant woman from paignton who fell unconscious says she owes her life to her three-year-old daughter after she used facetime to raise the alarm .
tracey riches suffers from severe morning sickness .
when she passed out on monday morning , mikayla called her grandmother saying she could n't wake mummy up .
she stayed connected until help arrived .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live for devon and cornwall
text: welcome to bbc local live in devon & cornwall .
we 'll be bringing you all the day 's news , sport , weather and travel and if you have a story email us .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online
